result.execSummary:
The defendant Brad C Hardtke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brad C Hardtke is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brad C Hardtke was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Brad C Hardtke was found guilty of Negligent Operation of Motor Vehicle, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Probation may be terminated after 6 months, if deemed appropriate by Agent.
3 days credit, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: BAIL APPLIED. ALL COSTS PAID IN FULL.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No violent contact with Heather P.
Domestic violence counseling through a State certified Batterers Intervention Program such as Alliance Counseling or Family Services of Waukesha.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - STAYED. Non working hours, standard release. To be used at Agent's discretion.

Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.

Defendant Brad C Hardtke in court with Attorney Joseph James Dorlack.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin and Law Intern Dominc Busalacchi.  Case called for sentencing hearing on revocation.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Dorlack makes statements regarding sentencing.  Daniel S. makes statements.   Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:  

COUNT #2:  90 Days jail (142 days credit) *CONCURRENT WITH COUNT #3   - TIME SERVED -  

COUNT #3:   6 Months jail  (142 days credit) *CONCURRENT WITH COUNT #2*   - TIME SERVED -  

*IF THERE ARE ANY UNPAID OR OUTSTANDING FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS PREVIOUSLY, THEY ARE NOW CONVERTED TO A CIVIL JUDGMENT*
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

Defendant to have no VIOLENT contact with victim.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms. 06-25-15 COURT GRANTS REQUEST FOR DEFENDANT TO OBTAIN BELONGINGS AT RESIDENCE WHEN ACCOMPANIED BY A LAW ENFORCEMENT MEMBER.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.  Defendant to report within the first business day after posting bail or released from custody.

Defendant Brad C Hardtke in court, in custody, with Attorney Joseph James Dorlack.   Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court grants motion - sets $1,000.00 signature bond.  Previous court date set remains on.
